context: hirsutum) plants after beet armyworm feeding. Headspace volatiles from Pieris rapae-damaged Arabidopsis plants contain (E)-β-ocimene at increased levels. Also, spider mite-infested lima bean leaves produce volatiles commonly found in the blend of caterpillar-damaged leaves, such as 4,8-dimethyl-1,3(E),7-nonatriene and (E)-β-ocimene. The low level of (E)-β-ocimene observed in samples from undamaged plants might result from a low level of constitutive gene expression (Fig. 4). A search of the M. truncatula EST database indicates no other expressed transcripts with high similarity to MtEBOS (data not shown). Furthermore, genomic M. truncatula DNA hybridization indicated a single strong band hybridizing to MtEBOS along with several weak bands. Taken together, the evidence suggests that (E)-β-ocimene synthase in M. truncatula is encoded by a single gene, or at the very least that any other forms of the enzyme do not share a high degree of sequence similarity.

The context suggests that the low levels of (E)-β-ocimene in undamaged plants may be due to low constitutive gene expression. This implies that gene expression plays a crucial role in the biosynthesis of this compound in response to environmental stressors.
